1274016288994705409.text: Nearly three years after Abraham Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation, #Juneteenth marks the total emancipation of slaves throughout the Confederacy. Slavery was a dark stain on our nation’s history & while we commemorate this day, let us not lose sight of its importance.

1269056680932843521.text: Along those lines, today’s national unemployment figures show a quicker than expected rebound with the economy adding 2.5 million jobs in May. We are turning the corner and recovering.

1268948636177702912.text: As a patriot and now your Congressman, I remain dedicated to defending our Constitutional rights. This is how we get better and evolve as a nation.

1265080800158060550.text:
7/7 As #MemorialDay2020 comes to an end, take one last moment to reflect and remember those who have laid down their life for our freedoms. We are Americans, and we do not lose. We must have the courage to fight thru our fears!
#NeverForget & #GodBlessAmerica.

1265080799256346624.text: 6/7 On this day more than any other, it is imperative that we come together as a nation to remember those who have given all, to pay respect, and honor their families. We are blessed to live in the greatest nation on earth.

1265080798203559944.text: 5/7 These deaths are sobering reminders that the danger of military service knows no bounds.

1265080797272383489.text: 4/7 The second hero, Lt. Col. Matt Kinkade, my roommate, and one of my best friends from our time served together on the USS Nimitz. He was killed in a T38 fighter jet accident in Oklahoma on November 21.

1265080796307689472.text: 3/7 The first, Gunnery Sgt. Diego Pongo of Simi Valley, who was tragically killed in combat operations on March 10 in Iraq. Diego was a great American and a loving father, son, and brother. It was my true honor to have the Pongo family join me for today’s ceremony.

1265080795309445120.text: 2/7 This year’s Memorial Day speech is dedicated to two American Heroes.

1265080793858281472.text: 1/7 Grateful to be invited back to speak at the Eternal Valley Memorial Park & Mortuary for Memorial Day. As a former Naval Officer, I have seen friends make the ultimate sacrifice and the memories never fade. https://t.co/UIRYuCv8c1

1262778584634208261.text: Honored to be sworn in as the next Congressman for #CA25. Will be an advocate for lower taxes, job creation and safely getting people back to work. https://t.co/bUeIejeUXG
